decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to get Arclight Phoenix into play and attacking. It includes a mix of cheap spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability, card draw spells to keep the deck running smoothly, and a few one-off finishers like Torch the Tower. The mana base is designed to support the deck's spells and ensure consistency in casting the Phoenix. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient aggression while using card draw to maintain resources.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset. It also includes some efficient creatures and enchantments to help stabilize the board and generate value. The mana base is designed to support the control game plan by providing consistent access to different colors of mana. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion gives the deck an additional source of value and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue opponents in longer games.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and deal damage to the opponent. It includes cards that can draw cards, discard cards, and generate mana efficiently to enable the graveyard recursion strategy. The deck also includes cards that can disrupt the opponent's plans and protect its own key pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and Phoenixes, maintaining pressure and control throughout the game.

This deck revolves around the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II, using cards like Guardian of New Benalia and Monument to Endurance to support the combo. The deck also includes Seasoned Hallowblade and Fleeting Spirit for added versatility, along with a control package of Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Pest Control to disrupt opponents. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces efficiently, with key lands like Brightclimb Pathway and Godless Shrine. Overall, the deck aims to assemble the combo quickly and overwhelm opponents with powerful synergies.

The deck aims to control the game by disrupting opponent's resources and board state through a combination of removal spells, disruption effects, and controlling creatures. The key strategy is to establish board presence while preventing opponent's threats from taking over the game using cards like Cleansing Wildfire, Portable Hole, and Anger of the Gods. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents and generating card advantage. By carefully managing resources and controlling the game tempo, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a game of attrition.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo involving Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Seasoned Hallowblade and Sheltered by Ghosts for protection, as well as cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push for disruption. The deck also includes lands like The Mycosynth Gardens and Monument to Endurance to support the combo strategy. Overall, the deck aims to quickly set up its combo pieces and outpace the opponent to secure victory in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and removal spells, while also utilizing disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Mutavault, while maintaining board control with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. With a mix of aggressive creatures, disruption, and removal, this deck aims to push through damage and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. It utilizes cards such as Bloodtithe Harvester and Fear of Missing Out to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand and ensure a smooth path to victory. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger ensures that the deck can close out games swiftly and decisively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the pieces needed for the Lotus Field combo, allowing the player to generate a large amount of mana and potentially win the game in a single turn. The deck includes cards like Stock Up and Scapeshift to help dig for the necessary pieces, while also including protection like Thassa's Oracle to secure the win condition. The deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Lotus Field, and then use cards like Scapeshift to search for combo pieces such as Crumbling Vestige and Echoing Deeps. The key strategy is to generate a large amount of mana in a single turn to cast powerful spells like Terror of the Peaks, while also utilizing Wishclaw Talisman for extra consistency in finding key cards. By efficiently cycling through the deck and maximizing mana production, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive combos.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also focuses on control elements with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, Seasoned Hallowblade and Sheltered by Ghosts provide protection for key pieces of the combo. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in its plays.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly generating damage and putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to control the board early with cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Reckless Rage, while also dealing direct damage with spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage. By utilizing low-cost creatures and direct damage spells, the deck aims to finish off the opponent quickly before they can stabilize or mount a strong defense.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger. The deck also includes burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to finish off the opponent or remove blockers. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to both red and green mana sources. The goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while maintaining board presence and closing out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on maintaining a fast and aggressive playstyle with a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, the deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain control of the board. The inclusion of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and graveyard interaction with cards like Graveyard Trespasser and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger helps to disrupt opponents' game plans while pushing for a quick victory. The deck also includes diverse types of removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to handle a variety of threats.

The main idea behind this deck is to create a powerful combo using Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate tokens and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards to control the board, protect your creatures, and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The combination of efficient removal spells and resilient creatures makes this deck a versatile and potent force in the Pioneer format. By carefully balancing aggression with defense, the deck aims to outmaneuver and outpace the opponent to achieve victory.

The deck focuses on creating a continuous loop of sacrificing and recurring creatures to trigger effects that deal damage to the opponent. By sacrificing Cauldron Familiar with Witch's Oven and then bringing it back with Scavenger's Talent, Mayhem Devil can deal damage to the opponent repeatedly. The deck also includes cards like Deadly Dispute and Claim the Firstborn to disrupt the opponent's board and gain additional value from sacrificing creatures. The overall strategy is to pressure the opponent with aggressive plays while generating incremental advantage through sacrificing and recurring creatures.
